repnme.cdata!:
Cape Verde - Privatization and Regulatory
            Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. The lessons learned from this project include:
            Political risks associated with privatization of key
            infrastructure assets need to be addressed: 2) Governments
            need to be made aware of the availability of internationally
            accepted regulations on transport, utilities, banking and
            other services. 3) Where a project implementation unit (PIU)
            faces staffing and performance difficulties, a systematic
            assessment is required during new project preparation to
            ascertain the readiness and resource requirements of the PIU
            to take on additional responsibilities. This project's
            PIU seems to have been overwhelmed by the additional tasks
            imposed on it resulting in some of the implementation
            problems.    Capital markets in small economies need to be
            realistically assessed:  5) Merits of sector versus
            multi-sector regulation should be weighed: While the
            benefits of centralizing regulatory capacity and authority
            in a single agency seem obvious especially in a small
            economy, the challenge of taking away regulatory authority
            from established line Ministries and the perceived loss of
            political power is not always easy for governments to manage effectively.

5084296.trustfund:
TF037674-CAPE VERDE - PRIVATIZATION TA,TF036605-CAPE VERDE - PRIVATIZATION AND
            REGULATORY CAPACITY BUILDING PROJECT
5084296.majtheme: Economic management,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Cape Verde - Privatization and Regulatory
            Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Privatization and Regulatory Capacity Building Project is to
            support the Government of Cape Verde (GOCV) efforts to
            alleviate poverty through the achievement of a higher,
            private sector-based economic growth. The Project will
            support GOCV policy of: (a) reducing the size of the State
            and changing its role from that of an implementor to one
            that provides an enabling environment necessary for private
            sector development; and (b) increasing private participation
            in key economic sectors including utilities, trade and
            transport, through the development of effective policy and
            regulatory frameworks. The project components include: (a)
            an accelerated privatization program, including support to
            this program, support to the public enterprise staff
            retrenchment plan, and public communication campaigns; (b) a
            consolidated regulatory framework, including the
            establishment of regulatory arrangements and institutions,
            support to civil aviation regulation, support to postal and
            telecommunication regulation, support to maritime transport
            regulation, support to urban transport regulation, and
            support to pharmaceuticals regulation and Consumer Product
            Standard and Quality Control Agency; and (c) project coordination.
